histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.SuggestedCardsHaveOffer
histogram.summary: When the user is shown the Autofill suggestions list, this metric records whether or not a credit card that is linked to an offer is shown as part of the suggestions.

histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.Suggestion2.{OfferType}
histogram.summary:
This metric is recorded every time an event related to an individual offer suggestion in the offers suggestions popup gets triggered. The offers suggestions popup gets displayed when a form's field that can be autofilled with an offer is selected, and there is no promo code already filled into the field.
This histogram is different from Autofill.Offer.Suggestion.{OfferType} because Autofill.Offer.Suggestion.{OfferType} logged that suggestions were shown when a promo code was already filled into the field and the field was clicked again, but in this case suggestions would not have been shown due to the field already having a full value. Since we updated the logic for when this histogram is logged to, we also needed to create a new histogram.

histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.SuggestionsPopupShown2
histogram.summary:
This metric records two enums, one for every time the offers suggestions popup is shown, and another for that same event, but only one per unique field. The offers suggestions popup is shown when a form's field that can be autofilled with an offer is selected, and there is no promo code already filled into the field.
This histogram is different from Autofill.Offer.SuggestionsPopupShown because Autofill.Offer.SuggestionsPopupShown logged that suggestions were shown when a promo code was already filled into the field and the field was clicked again, but in this case suggestions would not have been shown due to the field already having a full value. Since we updated the logic for when this histogram is logged to, we also needed to create a new histogram.

histogram.name: Autofill.Offer.SyncedOfferDataBeingValid
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the offer data is valid or not, measured whenever offer data is synced down via Sync.

histogram.name: Autofill.OfferNotificationBubbleOffer.{BubbleType}
histogram.summary: Records whether the offer notification bubble is the first such offer that the user has been shown or is reshown due to user actions. The metric is recorded when the bubble is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.OfferNotificationBubblePromoCodeButtonClicked.{BubbleType}
histogram.summary: Records when the copy promo code button for an offer notification bubble is clicked by the user. The subhistogram is the type of offer shown, such as GPay promo code offer or free-listing coupon offer.

histogram.name: Autofill.OfferNotificationBubbleResult.{BubbleType}{ShowType}
histogram.summary: Records the reason for closing the offer notification bubble. Recorded when the bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.OfferNotificationBubbleSuppressed.{BubbleType}
histogram.summary: Records when the offer notification bubble should show but gets suppressed due to reasons like show frequency rate control. The subhistogram is the type of offer shown, such as GPay promo code offer or free-listing coupon offer.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpAuth.{OtpAuthType}.Attempt
histogram.summary: Emits true when an OTP authentication starts and does not emit any value otherwise.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpAuth.{OtpAuthType}.RequestLatency.SelectChallengeOptionRequest
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip latency of the SelectChallengeOptionRequest in the OTP authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpAuth.{OtpAuthType}.RequestLatency.UnmaskCardRequest
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip latency of the UnmaskCardRequest in the OTP authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpAuth.{OtpAuthType}.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the result of the OTP authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpAuth.{OtpAuthType}.RetriableError
histogram.summary: Logs any retriable failure before the OTP authentication completes.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{OtpAuthType}.ErrorMessageShown
histogram.summary: Logs the type of the error when any temporary error is shown in the card unmask OTP dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{OtpAuthType}.NewOtpRequested
histogram.summary: Emits true when the "Get New Code" button is clicked and a new OTP is requested. Doesn't emit any other value.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{OtpAuthType}.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the reason of the closure when the card unmask OTP dialog is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{OtpAuthType}.Result.{WithError}
histogram.summary: Logs the reason of the closure when the card unmask OTP dialog is closed. This breaks down on whether any temporary error happened before the card unmask OTP dialog was closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.OtpInputDialog.{OtpAuthType}.Shown
histogram.summary: Emits true when the card unmask OTP dialog is shown. Doesn't emit any other value.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.CardBenefitsIsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks enablement of the credit card benefits toggle on the payment methods settings page. This histogram will be populated during profile loadup for users who have enabled autofill for payment methods. A value of true denotes that credit card benefits are enabled for the user, while false denotes that they are not.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.CheckoutFlow.ReauthUsage.{PaymentMethodType}.{AuthenticationMethod}
histogram.summary: Tracks the users mandatory reauth result during the checkout flow for opted-in users breakdown by each card type and each authentication method. Whenever a reauth opted-in user starts, succeeds or fails the mandatory reauth flow during a payments autofill form fill, we will log the MandatoryReauthAuthEvent to this histogram. This is logged in order to get the reauth usages and corresponding success rate for each breakdown. This subhistogram pertains to {PaymentMethodType}s that used {AuthenticationMethod} during the checkout flow.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.CvcStorageIsEnabled.Startup
histogram.summary: Tracks the user opt-in rate for CVC storage. This histogram will be populated during profile loadup for users who have enabled autofill for payments. It is not reported for incognito profiles. A value of true denotes that the CVC feature is enabled, while false denotes the feature is disabled.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.AuthEvent.SettingsPage.{ActionType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the auth result when the user tries to {ActionType} and mandatory reauth feature is enabled. Whenever a user tries to {ActionType}, we will log into the `flow started` bucket. The user would then be challenged with an auth, where if the auth was successful, we will log in the `flow succeded` bucket, else we will log in the `flow failed` bucket.

variant.name: DeleteCard
variant.summary: delete a card from the payment methods settings

variant.name: EditCard
variant.summary: edit a card on the payment methods settings

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.CheckoutFlow.ReauthOfferOptInDecision2
histogram.summary: Logs the detailed reason why (or why not) mandatory reauth opt-in was offered during a credit card checkout flow. Whenever we determine whether to offer the mandatory reauth opt-in prompt, we will log the decision result to this histogram.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.OptChangeEvent.{Source}.{ChangingStatus}
histogram.summary: Tracks the users auth result during the {ChangingStatus} flow for the mandatory reauth feature. Whenever a user triggers to change the mandatory reauth feature from the {Source}, we will log into the `flow started` bucket. The user would then be challenged with an auth, where if the auth was successful, we will log in the `flow succeded` bucket, else we will log in the `flow failed` bucket.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.OptInBubbleOffer{ShowType}
histogram.summary: Tracks events related to offering the mandatory reauth opt-in feature, for instance when it is shown or why it is not shown. This metric is recorded when the mandatory reauth opt-in prompt is or is not displayed. Mandatory reauth requires the user to unlock their device or pass a biometric auth when autofilling payment method information.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.OptInBubbleResult{ShowType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the reason the mandatory reauth opt-in prompt was closed. This metric is recorded when the user closes the mandatory reauth opt-in prompt. Mandatory reauth requires the user to unlock their device or pass a biometric auth when autofilling payment method information.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.MandatoryReauth.OptInConfirmationBubble
histogram.summary: Tracks various events related to the mandatory reauth opt-in confirmation prompt. These metrics are recorded when the prompt is displayed or the user interacts with the prompt. Mandatory reauth requires the user to unlock their device or pass a biometric auth when autofilling payment method information.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethods.SettingsPage.StoredCreditCardCountBeforeCardAdded
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of stored credit cards (both local and server) after a user adds a new local card through the Chrome payment methods settings page. The number of existing cards is calculated before saving the new card, but the value is recorded after saving the new card. Note that the new local card is not counted towards this number (i.e. if there aren't any existing cards when adding the new card, the "cards" bucket labeled 0 will be incremented).

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentMethodsSettingsPage.AddCardClicked
histogram.summary: Logs when the add card flow is started (currently only on Android). Recorded when a user starts the flow to add a new local card through the Chrome payment methods settings page.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentsDataManager.LocalCardAdded
histogram.summary: Logs when a credit card is saved locally for any reason. This includes when a server card upload fails, or when the user adds a new local card through the Chrome payment methods settings page.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentsNetworkInterface.RequestLatency.GetCardUploadDetails{Result}
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip latency of a GetCardUploadDetailsRequest in the PaymentsNetworkInterface. This is recorded when the response is received (right before the callback is called).

variant.summary: Includes all result types.

variant.name: .Failure
variant.summary: Failed to get the card upload details.

variant.name: .Success
variant.summary: Successfully got the card upload details.

histogram.name: Autofill.PaymentsNetworkInterface.{PaymentsRequestType}.ClientSideTimedOut
histogram.summary:
For an API call to Google Payments servers of type {PaymentsRequestType}, denotes whether or not that API call triggered the client-side timeout. Logged when the request either completes or times out on the client side, and only if there is a client-side timeout value specified for the given type.
The non-timeout case is logged only if the request succeeds according to the server, to try to best measure the ratio of failed calls that are due to the client-side timeout.

histogram.name: Autofill.PerfectFilling.{FormType}
histogram.summary:
For a form of type {FormType}, log at submission time if the filling experience was perfect. In a perfect filling experience, the user must have not edited any field, meaning that the filed must either be autofilled without prefix-matching and without further corrections, empty, have the same value as pageload or have its value set by JavaScript.
Note that the {FormType} is not mutually exclusive. If a single form contains both address and credit card information, the metric is recorded for each {FormType}. In such a combined form, both the address and the credit card information needs to be filled perfectly, in order to record perfect filling.

variant.name: Addresses
variant.summary: Form contains address information.

variant.name: CreditCards
variant.summary: Forms contains credit card information.

histogram.name: Autofill.Popup.NextIdleTimeTicksDelay
histogram.summary: Records how long it took for the UI thread in the browser process to become idle and record the TimeTicks at which the Autofill popup was shown. It is a safe-guard metric: For the majority of cases, this time should be negligible. Emitted whenever an Autofill popup (or keyboard acessory on Android) is shown and the AutofillPopupImprovedTimingChecks feature is enabled.

histogram.name: Autofill.Popup.VisibleDuration
histogram.summary: Records the duration that the autofill root popup remains open for all filling products. Emitted by the popup controller on hide. Note that it is not emitted for sub popups.

histogram.name: Autofill.Popup.VisibleDuration.{FillingProduct}
histogram.summary: Records the duration that the autofill root popup remains open. Emitted by the popup controller on hide. Note that it is not emitted for sub popups.

histogram.name: Autofill.PopupHidingReason
histogram.summary: This tracks the reasons for which the Autofill popup disappers or cannot be displayed. Recorded everytime an Autofill popup disappears or cannot be displayed.

histogram.name: Autofill.PopupHidingReason.{FillingProduct}
histogram.summary: This tracks per filling product the reasons for which the Autofill popup disappers or cannot be displayed. Recorded everytime an Autofill popup disappears or cannot be displayed.

histogram.name: Autofill.PopupInteraction.PopupLevel.{AutofillPopupInteractionLevel}
histogram.summary: This is emitted when {AutofillPopupInteractionLevel}. Its goal is to learn about user's behaviour related to the Autofill popup therefore it is only emitted on desktop.

histogram.name: Autofill.PopupInteraction.PopupLevel.{AutofillPopupInteractionLevel}.{FillingProduct}
histogram.summary: This is emitted when {AutofillPopupInteractionLevel}. This is also specific for a {FillingProduct}. It is emitted when the popup is shown, a suggestion is selected (hover) or accepted. Its goal is to learn about user's behaviour related to the Autofill popup therefore it is only emitted on desktop.

histogram.name: Autofill.PreFilledFieldClassifications.{FormType}
histogram.summary: Records the number of pre-filled fields that had a placeholder classification. The metric is emitted on form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.PreFilledFieldClassificationsQuality.{FormType}
histogram.summary: Records the quality of a placeholder classification. The metric is emitted on form submission and only if there was a placeholder prediction for the field.

histogram.name: Autofill.PreFilledFieldStatus.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: Records if an address or credit card field is pre-filled or empty on page load, by field type. The metric is emitted on form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.PreFilledFieldStatus.{FormType}
histogram.summary: Records if a field is pre-filled or empty on page load. The metric is emitted on form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileDeleted.{DeletionType}
histogram.summary:
Autofill.ProfileDeleted is emitted in the following scenarios: ExtendedMenu, Settings, Popup and KeyboardAccessory. There is also an "Any" bucket, which sums all of the above.
{DeletionType}

variant.name: Any
variant.summary: This metric records how many users tried to delete an address and whether they canceled or confirmed the deletion (regardless of how the address was deleted).

variant.name: ExtendedMenu
variant.summary: This metric records how many users clicked on the "Delete Address" button in the autofill extended menu, and whether they canceled or confirmed the deletion.

variant.name: KeyboardAccessory
variant.summary: This metric records how many users long-pressed on an address suggestion button in the keyboard accessory, and whether they canceled or confirmed the deletion.

variant.name: Popup
variant.summary: Counts how many users deleted an address using shift+delete while hovering on a first-level popup. This metric is emitted only for the "Confirmed" bucket, as the user cannot cancel this process.

variant.name: Settings
variant.summary: This metric records how many users pressed the "Delete address" button in chrome://settings, and whether they canceled or confirmed the deletion.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.InaccessibleFieldsRemoved.ByFieldType
histogram.summary: Logs that a given field type was removed on import, due to being setting inaccessible in the imported profile's country. Emitted on profile import.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.InaccessibleFieldsRemoved.Total
histogram.summary: Logs if at least one field was removed on import, due to being setting inaccessible in the imported profile's country. Emitted on profile import.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.MigrateProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for migrating a stored profile with record type AutofillProfile::RecordType::kLocalOrSyncable to the account storage. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.MigrateProfileEditedType
histogram.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a profile migration prompt. This metric is emitted once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.NewProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Obsolete metric, replaced by Autofill.ProfileImport.NewProfileDecision2. Logs the user's decision for storing a new address profile observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.NewProfileDecision2.{UserGroup}
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for storing a new address profile observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

variant.name: Aggregate
variant.summary: Aggregated data of all users.

variant.name: UserHasExistingProfile
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for users who have address profiles saved already.

variant.name: UserHasNoExistingProfiles
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for users who don't have any address profiles saved.

variant.name: UserHasQuasiDuplicateProfile
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for users where an existing address profile matches the import candidate after removing one field.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.NewProfileEditedType
histogram.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a new profile save prompt that was shown to the user when a new address profile is observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.PhoneNumberParsed
histogram.summary: Logs if a phone number was parsed successfully on profile import. Only emitted when a number is present in the submitted form.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.ProfileImportType
histogram.summary: The type of an import of an address that is observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted once the import decision is final. This does not necessarily mean that the user was prompted.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.SilentUpdatesProfileImportType
histogram.summary: The type of an import of an address that is observed in a form submission when the form does not satisfy profile import requirements. This metric is emitted once the import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.StorageNewAddressIsSavedTo
histogram.summary: Logs in which storage type the new address profile will be stored when the user accepted the save prompt that was shown to them after a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileAffectedType.{Decision}
histogram.summary: Logs that a specific type would have changed in a profile update process that received a specific {Decision}. The update was shown to the user because a profile similar to an already existing profile was observed in a form submission. Note that this metric collects the changed types before the user potentially applies additional edits. The metric is recorded on form submission once the user decision is final.

variant.name: Accepted
variant.summary: The user accepted the update flow from the initial prompt.

variant.name: Any
variant.summary: Any decision.

variant.name: AutoDeclined
variant.summary: The prompt is suppressed most likely because there is already another prompt shown on the same tab.

variant.name: Declined
variant.summary: The user declined the update flow from the initial prompt.

variant.name: EditAccepted
variant.summary: The user accepted the update flow from the edit dialog.

variant.name: EditDeclined
variant.summary: The user declined the update flow from the edit dialog.

variant.name: Ignored
variant.summary: The user ignored the prompt.

variant.name: MessageDeclined
variant.summary: The user swipes away the update Message. This is only relevant on mobile.

variant.name: MessageTimeout
variant.summary: The update message timed out before the user interacted. This is only relevant on mobile.

variant.name: Never
variant.summary: The user selected to never save a new profile on a given domain or update a specific profile (currently not supported).

variant.name: UserNotAsked
variant.summary: No prompt is shown and no decision is needed to proceed with the process.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileDecision
histogram.summary: Obsolete metric, replaced by Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileDecision2. Logs the user's decision for editing an already existing address after a similar profile was observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileDecision2.{UserGroup}
histogram.summary: Logs the user's decision for editing an already existing address after a similar profile was observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted at the end of an import process once the user-provided import decision is final.

variant.name: Aggregate
variant.summary: Aggregated data of all users.

variant.name: UserHasQuasiDuplicateProfile
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for users where an existing address profile matches the import candidate after removing one field. The profile to be updated is not considered an existing profile in the calculation of the duplication rank.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileEditedType
histogram.summary: Logs that a specific type was edited in a profile update prompt that was shown to the user when a profile similar to an already existing profile was observed in a form submission. This metric is emitted once the user-provided import decision is final.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileImport.UpdateProfileNumberOfAffectedFields.{Decision}
histogram.summary: Logs the number of fields that would be changed by an accepted update for any possible Decision. Note that this metric collects the number of changed fields before the user potentially applies additional edits. The metric is recorded on form submission once the user decision is final.

variant.name: Accepted
variant.summary: The user accepted the update flow from the initial prompt.

variant.name: Any
variant.summary: Any decision.

variant.name: AutoDeclined
variant.summary: The prompt is suppressed most likely because there is already another prompt shown on the same tab.

variant.name: Declined
variant.summary: The user declined the update flow from the initial prompt.

variant.name: EditAccepted
variant.summary: The user accepted the update flow from the edit dialog.

variant.name: EditDeclined
variant.summary: The user declined the update flow from the edit dialog.

variant.name: Ignored
variant.summary: The user ignored the prompt.

variant.name: MessageDeclined
variant.summary: The user swipes away the update Message. This is only relevant on mobile.

variant.name: MessageTimeout
variant.summary: The update message timed out before the user interacted. This is only relevant on mobile.

variant.name: Never
variant.summary: The user selected to never save a new profile on a given domain or update a specific profile (currently not supported).

variant.name: UserNotAsked
variant.summary: No prompt is shown and no decision is needed to proceed with the process.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQuality.ObservationCountBeforeSubmission.PerProfile
histogram.summary: At form submission, for every profile that was used to fill at least one field, records the total number of observation it has stored. Emitted once for every profile used, before collecting new observations.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQuality.ObservationCountBeforeSubmission.{Type}
histogram.summary: At form submission, for every autofilled field, records the number of observation that the filled profile has for the field's type. Emitted once per autofilled field at submission, before collecting new observations.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQuality.PerProfile
histogram.summary: The overall acceptance rate of all stored observations for the profile. Emitted once per profile at Chrome profile start-up.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQuality.StoredObservationsCount.PerProfile
histogram.summary: Records the total number of observations stored for a profile. Emitted once per profile at Chrome profile start-up.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQuality.StoredObservationTypes.{Type}
histogram.summary: Records which observation types are stored. Emitted once per profile and storable type at Chrome profile start-up. For additional supported types, consulte the metric of the corresponding storable type.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQuality.{Type}
histogram.summary: Records the acceptance rate of {Type}, based on the available observations for it. Emitted once per profile and storeable type at Chrome profile start-up. For additional supported types, consulte the metric of the corresponding storable type.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProfileTokenQualityScore
histogram.summary: Records the {number of observations (bits 0-3, capped at 10), quality score (bits 4-7), profile token (bits 8-15)} as a bitmask, if there were any observations. The score is an integer ranging from 0 to 10, as is the number of observations. Observations are from the profile that was used for filling. Emitted on form submission, after the profile's observations were updated.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProgressDialog.{FlowType}.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of the progress dialog, which can either be canceled (user canceled while it was in progress) or not canceled (user waited until confirmation). This dialog is shown in between other dialogs in a flow to provide a progress state to the user. If the user does not cancel it, after its related background task completes it moves on to the next dialog in the flow that it is a part of. The metric is recorded when this dialog is dismissed, and the result that gets logged is false if the user waited until confirmation or true if the user canceled the dialog.

histogram.name: Autofill.ProgressDialog.{FlowType}.Shown
histogram.summary: Records true every time the progress dialog is shown. This dialog is shown in between other dialogs in a payments autofill flow to provide a progress state to the user. If the user does not cancel it, after its related background task completes it moves on to the next dialog in the flow that it is a part of.

histogram.name: Autofill.QueriedCreditCardFormIsSecure
histogram.summary: For credit card forms that are queried for Autofill, a ratio of how many are within secure contexts (which includes mixed passive content).

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.BackoffDelay
histogram.summary: The delay of a network request for a query due to exponential backoff.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.FailingPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that were sent in a query that subsequently failed. This is to help determine the appropriate threshold at which autofill queries should switch from GET to POST, and if there are certain sizes of queries which are prone to failure.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.HttpResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: The http response code or net error code returned on a query.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.Method
histogram.summary: The HTTP method used to query the autofill server.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of a network request for a query.

histogram.name: Autofill.Query.WasInCache
histogram.summary: Was the autofill query response retrieved from the HTTP cache.

histogram.name: Autofill.Rationalization.OnlyFillWhenFocused.Quality
histogram.summary: Records whether the "only_fill_when_focused"-rationalization had a Good, Ok or Bad impact. Good means that the rationalization prevented the user from editing a field that would have been autofilled if the rationalization didn't happen. Ok means that the rationalization had no impact of whether the user edited the field or not. Bad means that the rationalization made the user edit a field (by either typing or triggering autofill a second time) that wouldn't have been edited if the rationalization didn't happen.

histogram.name: Autofill.RendererFillSkipReason
histogram.summary: Logs the reason for skipping filling a field in the renderer. Emitted every time a field is passed to ShouldSkipFillField in form_autofill_util.cc.

histogram.name: Autofill.ResetAutofillPrefToChrome
histogram.summary: Clank only. Logs whether the user decided to use 3P password managers but a precondition prevented their use so Chrome fell back to using the built-in password manager. Emitted only once per cold start of Chrome when the first tab is created.

histogram.name: Autofill.RiskBasedAuth.{CardType}.Attempt
histogram.summary: Emits true when a risk-based authentication starts, and does not emit any value otherwise. Currently, ServerCard and VirtualCard support risk-based authentication.

histogram.name: Autofill.RiskBasedAuth.{CardType}.Latency
histogram.summary: Logs the roundtrip latency of the UnmaskCardRequest during risk-based authentication. It is logged when the UnmaskCardRequest is completed.

histogram.name: Autofill.RiskBasedAuth.{CardType}.Result
histogram.summary: Logs the result of a risk-based unmasking process when the unmasking is finished (whether it succeeded or the failure reason). Broken down by the type of card to be unmasked.

histogram.name: Autofill.RiskDataLoading.Latency
histogram.summary: Logs the latency of risk data loading. It is logged when the loading is completed or timed out.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCardCardholderNamePrefilled
histogram.summary: If the cardholder name fix flow is shown when credit card upload is offered, records if the cardholder name textfield was prefilled with the name from the user's Google Account.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCardCardholderNameWasEdited
histogram.summary: If the cardholder name fix flow is shown during credit card upload and the user accepts upload, logs whether the final cardholder name was changed from its prefilled value or not.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCardRequestExpirationDateReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason expiration date was explicitly requested from the user during credit card save.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptOffer.{SaveDestination}.{ShowType}{SaveType}
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which the Autofill save credit card prompt is shown or not to save a credit card {SaveDestination}, {SaveType}. Logged when the flow is triggered and the decision of whether or not to offer credit card save is made. It was a {ShowType}.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptResult.{SaveDestination}.{ShowType}{SaveType}
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which (and how) users accept or deny the Autofill save credit card prompt to save credit card {SaveDestination}. Logged when the prompt closes.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCreditCardPromptResult{SaveDestination}.{UserGroup}
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept or deny the Autofill save credit card prompt to save credit card {SaveDestination}. Only first shows are recorded. Logged when the prompt closes.

variant.name: Aggregate
variant.summary: Aggregated data of all users.

variant.name: UserHasNoCards
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for users who don't have any credit cards saved.

variant.name: UserHasSavedCards
variant.summary: Metrics are recorded for users who have credit cards saved already.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCvcPromptOffer{AutofillSaveCreditCardPromptDestination}{ShowType}
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which the Autofill save CVC prompt is shown or not to save CVC {AutofillSaveCreditCardPromptDestination}. Logged when the flow is triggered and the prompt should be shown. It was a {ShowType}.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveCvcPromptResult{AutofillSaveCreditCardPromptDestination}{ShowType}
histogram.summary: The relative frequency with which users accept or deny the Autofill save CVC prompt to save CVC {AutofillSaveCreditCardPromptDestination}. Logged when the prompt closes. It was a {ShowType}.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveIbanPromptOffer{IbanTypeToBeSaved}{ShowType}
histogram.summary: Records every time the save IBAN bubble or omnibox icon (due to maxstrike reached) is offered to the user, broken down by destination and show type. On Android, the ShowType is only logged as "FirstShow" since there is no option to retrigger the prompt or reshow it once dismissed.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveIbanPromptResult{IbanTypeToBeSaved}.SavedWithNickname
histogram.summary: Records when the user accepts the bubble to save an IBAN, with or without nickname.

histogram.name: Autofill.SaveIbanPromptResult{IbanTypeToBeSaved}{ShowType}
histogram.summary: Records when the user makes a decision on the save IBAN bubble, broken down by destinations. On Android, the ShowType is only logged as "FirstShow" since there is no option to retrigger the prompt or reshow it once dismissed.

histogram.name: Autofill.ScanCreditCard.Completed
histogram.summary: Whether a credit card scan was completed or cancelled.

histogram.name: Autofill.ScanCreditCard.Duration{CreditCardScanSuccess}
histogram.summary: How long a credit card took to scan. {CreditCardScanSuccess}

variant.name: _Cancelled
variant.summary: Credit card scan was cancelled.

variant.name: _Completed
variant.summary: Credit card scan completed.

histogram.name: Autofill.ScanCreditCardPrompt
histogram.summary: Usage of the "Scan card" control item.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerCardLinkClicked
histogram.summary: Logged when the user clicks on the server credit card link in the settings page.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerCardUnmask.{CardType}.Attempt
histogram.summary: Emits true when a server card unmasking process starts and does not emit any value otherwise.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerCardUnmask.{CardType}.FormSubmission
histogram.summary: Emits true when a form is submitted with information fetched in a server card unmasking process, and does not emit any value otherwise.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerCardUnmask.{CardType}.Result.{FlowType}
histogram.summary: Logs the result of a server card unmasking process when the unmasking is finished (whether it succeeded or otherwise reason of the failure). It includes the type of the card to be unmasked and the flow type (what authentication used) in the unmasking.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerIbanLinkClicked
histogram.summary: Logs the sync state when the user clicks on a server IBAN's [Edit in Google Pay] link.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerQueryResponse
histogram.summary: The usefulness of Autofill server information.

histogram.name: Autofill.ServerResponseHasDataForForm
histogram.summary: Tracks whether Autofill server had at least some prediction data for a given form at query response time.

histogram.name: Autofill.Settings.AutofillOptionsReferrerAndroid
histogram.summary: Records which entry point opened the Autofill Options screen. Recorded on Android.

histogram.name: Autofill.Settings.EditAddress
histogram.summary: This metric measures how many users clicked on the edit option from the settings page and what their next action was. The metric is logged when the user closes the edit address profile dialog, either after saving an updated profile or after canceling.

histogram.name: Autofill.Settings.ToggleUseThirdPartyFilling
histogram.summary: Records true whenever the user opts into the third party autofill experience. Records false whenever they switch back to the default, Chrome-provided autofill experience. Recorded when the user flips the toggle in the autofill options settings.

histogram.name: Autofill.SettingsPage.ButtonClicked.{CardType}.{Button}
histogram.summary: Emits true whenever {Button} is clicked in the mobile {CardType} edit page. Never emits false.

variant.name: EditCard
variant.summary: the edit button

variant.name: Enroll
variant.summary: the enroll button

variant.name: Unenroll
variant.summary: the unenroll button

histogram.name: Autofill.SettingsPage.LocalIbanActions
histogram.summary: Records user interactions with local IBANs on the Chrome payment methods settings page.

histogram.name: Autofill.ShadowPredictions.{SourcePair}
histogram.summary: 3-way comparison between {SourcePair} and the value that was in a field on submission. This is emitted after an autofillable form has been submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.SharedStorageServerCardDataSetResult
histogram.summary: Records the shared storage Set operation result that is returned from the SharedStorageManager, each time the cached autofill server credit card information is updated and inserted into the shared storage database, implemented in ContentAutofillSharedStorageHandler. SharedStorageManager provides the API to update the Shared Storage database, which enables privacy-preserving cross-site data storage.

histogram.name: Autofill.SkippingFormFillDueToChangedFieldCount
histogram.summary: Records whether an autofill operation was skipped because the number of fields to be filled is different than that number of fields registered in the form cache.

histogram.name: Autofill.Snackbar.{SnackbarType}.ActionClicked
histogram.summary: Emits true when the action button on the autofill snackbar is clicked and does not emit any value otherwise.

histogram.name: Autofill.Snackbar.{SnackbarType}.Shown
histogram.summary: Emits true when the autofill snackbar is displayed and does not emit any value otherwise.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredCreditCardCount
histogram.summary: The number of credit cards a user has stored, measured at Chrome profile launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredCreditCardCount.Server.WithCardArtImage
histogram.summary: The number of server cards with a valid card art image, measured at Chrome profile launch.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredCreditCardCount.Server.WithVirtualCardMetadata
histogram.summary: The number of server cards with virtual card metadata, measured at Chrome profile launch.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredCreditCardDisusedCount
histogram.summary: The number of disused credit cards a user has stored, measured at Chrome profile launch time. This is only reported for users who have at least one stored credit card.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredIbanCount
histogram.summary: The number of local and server IBANs a user has stored, measured at Chrome profile launch time. It's logged once per profile load.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredIbanCount.{IbanRecordType}
histogram.summary: The number of local or server IBANs a user has stored, measured at Chrome profile launch time. It's logged once per profile load.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredIbanCount.{IbanRecordType}.WithNickname
histogram.summary: The number of local or server IBANs with nickname a user has stored, measured at Chrome profile launch time. It's logged one per profile load.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredIbanDisusedCount.{IbanRecordType}
histogram.summary: The number of disused IBANs a user has stored, measured at Chrome profile launch time. This is only reported for users who have at least one stored IBAN.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileCount.{Suffix}
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill addresses a user has stored of the given category or in total, measured at launch time.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileCountAtAutofillableFormSubmission
histogram.summary: The number of Autofill addresses a user has stored, measured when an autofillable form is submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileDisusedCount.{Category}
histogram.summary: The number of stored Autofill address profiles of the given category, which have not been used in a sufficiently long time for autofill to consider them disused. Measured once per Chrome user profile launch. This metric is only recorded if the user has at least one profile of that category.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileUsedCount.{Category}
histogram.summary: The number of stored Autofill address profiles of the given category, which are not in the disused state. Measured once per Chrome user profile launch. This metric is only recorded if the user has at least one profile of that category.

histogram.name: Autofill.StoredProfileUsedPercentage.{Category}
histogram.summary: The percentage of stored Autofill address profiles of the given category, which are not in the disused state. Measured once per Chrome user profile launch. This metric is only recorded if the user has at least one profile of that category.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.CreditCardSaveNotOfferedDueToMaxStrikes
histogram.summary: Records when credit card save is not offered (either at all on mobile or by simply not showing the bubble on desktop) due to the candidate card having too many strikes.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.IbanSaveNotOfferedDueToMaxStrikes
histogram.summary: Records when IBAN save prompt is not offered due to the candidate IBAN having too many strikes. It is recorded when offering IBAN save to user and detects the max strikes has been reached.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.LocalCardMigrationNotOfferedDueToMaxStrikes
histogram.summary: Records when local card migration is not offered due to the candidate's LocalCardMigration strike count reaching maximum strikes.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.NthStrikeAdded.{AutofillStrikeDatabaseProjectType}
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" the {AutofillStrikeDatabaseProjectType} feature had when a strike was added for it.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikeDatabaseInitFailed
histogram.summary: When a StrikeDatabase fails to initialize, records the number of consecutive failed initialization attempts.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikesPresentWhenIbanSaved{IbanTypeToBeSaved}
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" a given IBAN had when a user decided to save it. It is recorded right after the user clicks the Accept button.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikesPresentWhenLocalCardMigrationAccepted
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" a user has when local card migration is accepted.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikesPresentWhenLocalCardSaved
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" a given card had when a user opted to save the card to Chrome.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikesPresentWhenServerCardSaved
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" a given card had when a user successfully uploaded the card to Google Payments.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikesPresentWhenStrikeExpired.{AutofillStrikeDatabaseProjectType}
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" present in a StrikeDatabase entry when a strike expired for the {AutofillStrikeDatabaseProjectType} feature.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.StrikesPresentWhenVirtualCardEnrolled
histogram.summary: Records the number of "strikes" a given card had when a user successfully enrolled in a virtual card.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.VirtualCardEnrollmentNotOfferedDueToMaxStrikes
histogram.summary: Records and emits true when virtual card enrollment is not offered due to the candidate's strike count reaching maximum strikes.

histogram.name: Autofill.StrikeDatabase.VirtualCardEnrollmentNotOfferedDueToRequiredDelay
histogram.summary: Records and emits true when virtual card enrollment is not offered due to the required delay not yet passing since candidate's last strike.

histogram.name: Autofill.SubmissionDetectionSource.{SubmissionComponent}
histogram.summary: Metric to measure the source of each submission. Emitted once per inferred submission by {SubmissionComponent}.

histogram.name: Autofill.SubmittedCardState
histogram.summary: Metric to measure credit card state when form is submitted, specifically if it had a valid card number and/or expiration date.

histogram.name: Autofill.SubmittedServerCardExpirationStatus
histogram.summary: Metric to measure if a submitted card's expiration date matches the same server card's expiration date. Cards are considered to be the same if they have the same network and last four digits.

histogram.name: Autofill.SubmittedValuePatterns
histogram.summary: Metric to measure if a submitted form contains any recognizable value patterns (e.g., Unified Payment Interface Virtual Payment address (UPI VPA)). Reported for every submitted non-empty visible field observed by Autofill.

histogram.name: Autofill.Suggestion.AcceptanceFieldValueLength.{SuggestionType}
histogram.summary: Records how long was the field's value before accepting an Autofill {SuggestionType} suggestion. Emitted every time a suggestion is accepted. Used to asses the quality of suggestion prefix matching.

histogram.name: Autofill.Suggestion.StrikeSuppression.Address
histogram.summary: Records whether address suggestions were suppressed because of a field reaching the strike limit due to the user consistently ignoring suggestions on that field. Emitted only on desktop (where strike suppression exists) every time regular (non-manual fallback) address suggestions are triggered.

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionAccepted.OffTheRecord
histogram.summary: Records acceptance of autofill suggestions in regular and off-the-record modes.

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionAccepted.SuggestionRankingDifference.CreditCard
histogram.summary: Logs the ranking difference for a recently-selected Autofill suggestion, recording if the suggestion was ranked higher or lower in the new ranking algorithm compared to the legacy ranking algorithm.

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionAcceptedIndex{SuggestionType}
histogram.summary: The index of the accepted Autofill suggestion in the popup. {SuggestionType}

variant.name: .Other
variant.summary: Unspecified suggestions

histogram.name: Autofill.Suggestions.AcceptedType
histogram.summary: Records the type of an accepted Autofill suggestion. The metric is recorded every time a user accepts an autofill suggestion (no submission needed).

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionsCount{SuggestionType}
histogram.summary: The number of suggestions shown in the Autofill popup. Recorded whenever suggestions are shown. {SuggestionType}

histogram.name: Autofill.SuggestionShown.OffTheRecord
histogram.summary: Records showing of autofill suggestions in regular and off-the-record modes.

histogram.name: Autofill.TestAddressesEvent
histogram.summary: Recorded when a test address suggestion is shown or selected. These suggestions are displayed when devtools is open, therefore only in desktop. A top level test address suggestion will be shown when the user clicks on an address classified field while devtools is open. This suggestion has child suggestions representing well-formatted addressses from different countries, choosing one of them will fill the form and emit an selected event.

histogram.name: Autofill.TestAddressSelected
histogram.summary: Recorded when a test address suggestion is selected. Test address suggestions are displayed when devtools is open, therefore only in desktop. A top level test address suggestion will be shown when the user clicks on an address classified field while devtools is open. This suggestion has child suggestions representing well-formatted addressses from different countries, choosing one of them will fill the form and emit this metric, representing which country was chosen.

histogram.name: Autofill.Timing.ParseFormUntilInteraction2
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between a form is parsed and the user has interacted with a field in it. In the case of reparses the first parsing time is used.

histogram.name: Autofill.Timing.{AutofillTimedFunction}
histogram.summary: Number of milliseconds passed between the start and end of {AutofillTimedFunction}.

histogram.name: Autofill.TimingInterval.{Caller}.{Callee}.{Event}
histogram.summary: Records the number of microseconds passed the last preceding {Event} event and (the end of) {Callee}, which has been called by {Caller}. The metric is recorded on all platforms except for iOS and is only recorded for clients with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Autofill.TimingPrecise.{Callee}
histogram.summary: Records the number of microseconds passed between the start and end of {Callee}. Where a more detailed breakdown exists, this metric is effectively the aggregation of Autofill.TimingPrecise.{Callee}.*. The metric is recorded on all platforms except for iOS and is only recorded for clients with high-resolution clocks.

variant.name: InferLabelForElement
variant.summary: Time for all InferLabelForElement calls for the fields of a form.

histogram.name: Autofill.TimingPrecise.{Callee}.{Caller}
histogram.summary: Records the number of microseconds passed between the start and end of {Callee} called by {Caller}. The metric is recorded on all platforms except for iOS and is only recorded for clients with high-resolution clocks.

histogram.name: Autofill.TouchToFill.CreditCard.AutofillUsedAfterTouchToFillDismissal
histogram.summary: Records whether a user has still used autofill after dismissing the payments bottom sheet. There is a fallback to still allow the user to autofill the form after dismissing the bottom sheet, that is to use the keyboard accessory suggestion. This metric is recorded when submitting the form: true - if there is at least one autofilled field in the submitted form and the payments bottom sheet was shown and dismissed by user, false - otherwise. The metrics is recorded only if the payments bottom sheet was displayed for the form submitted.

histogram.name: Autofill.TouchToFill.CreditCard.FillingCorrectness
histogram.summary: For the Payments bottom sheet (Touch To Fill for credit cards), tracks whether or not the user has edited at least one of the autofilled fields before submitting the form. The metric is recorded on form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.TouchToFill.CreditCard.NumberOfCardsShown
histogram.summary: The number of credit cards shown in the Touch To Fill bottom sheet. Recorded when showing the bottom sheet.

histogram.name: Autofill.TouchToFill.CreditCard.Outcome2
histogram.summary: Records the outcome with which the bottom sheet was closed: credit card selected, virtual card selected, go to payment settings, scan new credit card or dismissed with no action. The metric is recorded right after user has done the action: the credit card selection or some other option (which always leads to the bottom sheet being closed) or swiped the sheet to close it. See the TouchToFillCreditCardMediator.java for details. Note that "Go to payment settings" click is also considered as the outcome, although it doesn't close the Touch To Fill. So in this case there will be a double count for one bottom sheet showing.

histogram.name: Autofill.TouchToFill.CreditCard.PerfectFilling
histogram.summary: For the Payments bottom sheet (Touch To Fill for credit cards), logs at submission time if the filling experience was perfect or not. In a perfect filling experience, all non-empty fields have been autofilled without subsequent corrections. The metric is logged on form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.TouchToFill.CreditCard.SelectedIndex
histogram.summary: The index of the selected credit card in the Touch To Fill bottom sheet. Recorded when user selects a credit card from the list.

histogram.name: Autofill.TouchToFill.CreditCard.TriggerOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the attempt to trigger Touch To Fill for credit cards. It is recorded only when the touch to fill feature is enabled and the form is parsed as a credit card form by autofill.

histogram.name: Autofill.TouchToFill.Iban.NumberOfIbansShown
histogram.summary: The number of IBANs shown in the Touch To Fill bottom sheet. Recorded when showing the bottom sheet.

histogram.name: Autofill.TouchToFill.Iban.SelectedIndex
histogram.summary: The index of the selected IBAN in the Touch To Fill bottom sheet. Recorded when user selects an IBAN from the list.

histogram.name: Autofill.TouchToFill.Iban.TriggerOutcome
histogram.summary: Records the outcome of the attempt to trigger Touch To Fill for IBANs. It is recorded only when the form is parsed as an IBAN by autofill on Chrome Android and the user clicks on the form field.

histogram.name: Autofill.UndoAfterFill.{FormType}
histogram.summary: Records whether a user used Undo Autofill in his filling journey or not. Emitted once per form submission, only if the user autofilled some suggestion prior to submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.Duration{AutofillUnmaskPromptCloseReasonEvents}

variant.name: .AbandonUnmasking
variant.summary: Abandon unmasking

variant.name: .NoAttempts
variant.summary: No attempts

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.Events
histogram.summary: Events tracking the usage of the unmasking prompt. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in a autofill dropdown.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.GetRealPanDuration
histogram.summary: Duration of the GetRealPan API call. This API call is triggered by the unmasking prompt when the user types information to verify their ownership of the card being fetched.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.GetRealPanDuration.{CardType}.{Result}
histogram.summary: Duration of the GetRealPan API call. This API call is triggered by the unmasking prompt when the user types information to verify their ownership of the card being fetched. Broken down by the type of the card being fetched and the result.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.GetRealPanResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of the GetRealPan API call. This API call is triggered by the unmasking prompt when the user types information to verify their ownership of the card being fetched.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.GetRealPanResult.{CardType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of the GetRealPan API call. This API call is triggered by the unmasking prompt when the user types information to verify their ownership of the card being fetched. Broken down by type of the card being fetched.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.TimeBeforeAbandonUnmasking
histogram.summary: Time the user waited before abandoning an unmasking operation. In such a scenario, the user is cancelling a pending unmasking operation (possibly because it is taking too long). The time measured here corresponds to the time between the user clicking the "Verify" button and then clicking "Cancel".

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.UnmaskingDuration
histogram.summary: Duration between the user clicking the Verify button within the unmasking prompt until we get a response back from the server. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in an autofill dropdown.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.UnmaskingDuration.{CardType}.{Result}
histogram.summary: Duration between the user clicking the Verify button within the unmasking prompt until we get a response back from the server. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in an autofill dropdown. Broken down by the type of the card being fetched and the result.

histogram.name: Autofill.UnmaskPrompt.{CardType}.Events
histogram.summary: Events tracking the usage of the unmasking prompt, recorded for {CardType}. This prompt is triggered when a user selects a masked card in a autofill dropdown.

histogram.name: Autofill.Upload.BackoffDelay
histogram.summary: The delay of a network request for an upload due to exponential backoff.

histogram.name: Autofill.Upload.FailingPayloadSize
histogram.summary: The number of bytes that were sent in an upload that subsequently failed. This is to help determine if there are certain upload sizes which are prone to failure.

histogram.name: Autofill.Upload.HttpResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: The http response code or net error code returned on an upload.

histogram.name: Autofill.Upload.RequestDuration
histogram.summary: The duration of a network request for an upload.

histogram.name: Autofill.UploadAcceptedCardOrigin
histogram.summary: Measures if a card for which upload was accepted is already stored as a local card on the device or if it has not yet been seen.

histogram.name: Autofill.UploadEvent{AutofillUploadEvents}
histogram.summary: Whether or not an upload was sent after having been triggered by a form submission or proxy-form-submission. {AutofillUploadEvents}

variant.name: .DomMutationAfterAutofill
variant.summary: DOM Mutation After Autofill

variant.name: .FormSubmission
variant.summary: Form Submission

variant.name: .FrameDetached
variant.summary: Frame Detached

variant.name: .ProbablyFormSubmitted
variant.summary: Probable Form Submission

variant.name: .SameDocumentNavigation
variant.summary: Same Document Navigation

variant.name: .XhrSucceeded
variant.summary: XHR Succeeded

histogram.name: Autofill.UploadIban.{UploadIbanAction}
histogram.summary: Records every time the IBAN upload save is offered to the user, as well as when there are actions made on the offer. The metric is broken down by IBAN origins (new IBAN or an existing local IBAN).

variant.name: Accepted
variant.summary: The user has accepted the offer

variant.name: Declined
variant.summary: The user has declined the offer

variant.name: Ignored
variant.summary: The user has ignored the offer

variant.name: Offered
variant.summary: It is an IBAN upload save offer

histogram.name: Autofill.UploadOfferedCardOrigin
histogram.summary: Measures if a card for which upload was offered is already stored as a local on the device or if it has not yet been seen.

histogram.name: Autofill.UsedCachedServerCard
histogram.summary: Records the number of times that the cache for unmasked server cards has been accessed for a given card. For example, if the cache is being accessed and it has already been accessed for the card twice before, then "3" is recorded.

histogram.name: Autofill.UsedCachedVirtualCard
histogram.summary: Records the number of times that the cache for virtual cards has been accessed for a given card. For example, if the cache is being accessed and it has already been accessed for the card twice before, then "3" is recorded.

histogram.name: Autofill.UserAcceptedSuggestionAtIndex.{FillingProduct}.{Context}
histogram.summary: The index of the accepted Autofill suggestion, split by context. Logged when the user taps on a suggestion. iOS only. {FillingProduct} {Context}

histogram.name: Autofill.Vcn3ds.FlowEvents
histogram.summary: Tracks when a user starts and completes a VCN 3DS flow, as well as events throughout the flow. The metrics for flow started log when we initiate a VCN 3DS auth flow and are about to either show the consent dialog or the pop-up directly. The metrics for flow completion are logged when the full flow is considered completed, and are broken down by completion result. Other events are logged at the moment they occur. This histogram is an aggregated version of the Autofill.Vcn3ds.FlowEvents.{ConsentAlreadyGiven} histogram.

histogram.name: Autofill.Vcn3ds.FlowEvents.{ConsentAlreadyGiven}
histogram.summary: Tracks when a user starts and completes a VCN 3DS flow, as well as events throughout the flow. The metrics for flow started log when we initiate a VCN 3DS auth flow and are about to either show the consent dialog or the pop-up directly. The metrics for flow completion are logged when the full flow is considered completed, and are broken down by completion result. Other events are logged at the moment they occur. The histogram is broken down into sub-histograms by whether user consent was already given prior to the flow starting. If consent was already given, the consent dialog is not shown and the pop-up is immediately triggered, otherwise the consent dialog is shown and must be accepted for the pop-up to be triggered.

histogram.name: Autofill.Vcn3ds.Latency.{Result}
histogram.summary: Logs the latency of the VCN 3DS authentication, from the time the pop-up was shown to the time the pop-up was closed. Logged when the pop-up closes due to the user completing the authentication successfully or unsuccessfully. Not logged when the user manually closes the pop-up.

histogram.name: Autofill.Vcn3ds.PaymentsWindowUserConsentDialogResult
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of the payments window user consent dialog, broken down by closed reason. Logged when the dialog is closing.

histogram.name: Autofill.Vcn3ds.PaymentsWindowUserConsentDialogShown
histogram.summary: Tracks the number of shows for the payments window user consent dialog. Logged every time a dialog is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.Enroll.Attempt.{Source}
histogram.summary: Emits true whenever a virtual card Enroll request is sent. It is broken down by the source of the request (i.e., Upstream, Downstream, settings page).

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.Enroll.Result.{Source}
histogram.summary: Emitted whenever a virtual card Enroll response is received. It is broken down by the source of the request (i.e., Upstream, Downstream, settings page) and logged based on whether the request suceeded.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.GetDetailsForEnrollment.Attempt.{Source}
histogram.summary: Emits true whenever a virtual card GetDetailsForEnrollment request is sent. It is broken down by the source of the request (i.e., Upstream, Downstream, settings page).

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.GetDetailsForEnrollment.Latency.{Source}.{Result}
histogram.summary: Records the latency for the GetDetailsForEnrollment roundtrip call. The timer starts when a GetDetailsForEnrollment request is sent. It is recorded (the timer stops) when a GetDetailsForEnrollment response is received.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.GetDetailsForEnrollment.Result.{Source}
histogram.summary: Emits whenever a virtual card GetDetailsForEnrollment response is received. It is broken down by the source of the request (i.e., Upstream, Downstream, settings page) and logged based on whether the request suceeded.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.MetadataSynced
histogram.summary: The number of times that virtual card metadata is propagated via Chrome Sync. It is logged based on whether the metadata is for an existing card or a new card.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.StandaloneCvc.FormEvents
histogram.summary: These metrics log the autofill form events for virtual card standalone CVC fields, such as when suggestion(s) is/are shown, selected, or filled for a virtual card standalone CVC field, or the form is about to be submitted or submitted after a virtual card standalone CVC field is autofilled.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.Unenroll.Attempt.{Source}
histogram.summary: Emits true whenever a virtual card Unenroll request is sent. It is broken down by the source of the request (i.e., Upstream, Downstream, settings page).

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.Unenroll.Result.{Source}
histogram.summary: Emitted whenever a virtual card Unenroll response is received. It is broken down by the source of the request (i.e., Upstream, Downstream, settings page) and logged based on whether the request suceeded.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.{Dialog}
histogram.summary: Emits true when a user accepts {Dialog} in the mobile virtual card edit page. Emits false if the user declines.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCard.{Dialog}.LinkClicked
histogram.summary: Records which link is clicked whenever a user clicks on links in {Dialog} in the mobile virtual card edit page. The links are the education text link, Google legal message link, and issuer legal message link.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnroll.CardArtImageAvailable.{EnrollmentSource}
histogram.summary: This metric emits true if the card art image is available for use in the virtual card enroll bubble for the {EnrollmentSource} and false if it is not available. Recorded when bubble is shown.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnroll.LinkClicked.{EnrollmentSource}.{LinkType}
histogram.summary: This metric emits true when a user clicks on virtual card enrollment link from flows that start from the {EnrollmentSource}.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnrollBubble.ConfirmationResult.{IsCardEnrolled}
histogram.summary: Records the reason for closing the virtual card confirmation bubble. IsCardEnrolled ({IsCardEnrolled}) indicates whether the bubble shown was for a successful VCN enrollment or not. Recorded when the confirmation bubble is closed.

variant.name: CardEnrolled
variant.summary: Credit card was successfully enrolled.

variant.name: CardNotEnrolled
variant.summary: Credit card failed to be enrolled.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnrollBubble.ConfirmationShown.{IsCardEnrolled}
histogram.summary: Records if the virtual card confirmation bubble is shown after credit card enrollment is completed. IsCardEnrolled ({IsCardEnrolled}) indicates whether the confirmation bubble is for a successful VCN enrollment or not. Recorded after the confirmation bubble is shown or after the decision to not show the confirmation bubble.

variant.name: CardEnrolled
variant.summary: Credit card was successfully enrolled.

variant.name: CardNotEnrolled
variant.summary: Credit card failed to be enrolled.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnrollBubble.LatencySinceUpstream
histogram.summary: Logs the latency between Save Card Bubble accepted and the timestamp for when the Virtual Card Enroll Bubble is shown. This metric is logged right before the Virtual Card Enroll Bubble is shown, but if web contents are unavailable it will be logged before waiting for web contents to become available.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnrollBubble.LoadingResult
histogram.summary: Records the reason for closing the virtual card loading bubble. Recorded when the loading bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnrollBubble.LoadingShown
histogram.summary: Records if the virtual card loading bubble is shown during credit card enrollment. Recorded after the loading bubble is shown or after the decision to not show the loading bubble.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnrollBubble.MaxStrikesLimitReached
histogram.summary: This metric is recorded every time the virtual card enrollment bubble would have been offered but is not offered due to the maximum number of strikes being reached. It logs the source for the flow where the bubble would have been shown, if the strike limit did not block it (for example, upstream i.e. the save card flow).

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnrollBubble.Result.{EnrollmentSource}{ShowType}{PreviousStrikes}
histogram.summary: Records the reason for closing the virtual card enroll bubble for flows that start from the {EnrollmentSource}. ShowType ({ShowType}) indicates whether the bubble is a first time show or a reshow triggered by the user. A subcategory indicating ({PreviousStrikes}) is also logged. Recorded when the bubble is closed.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnrollBubble.Shown.{EnrollmentSource}
histogram.summary: Records the reason for starting the virtual card enroll bubble for flows that start from {EnrollmentSource}. Recorded when the bubble is shown. Records false the first time the bubble is shown, true for subsequent bubble shows.

histogram.name: Autofill.VirtualCardEnrollmentStrikeDatabase.{EnrollmentSource}
histogram.summary: Logged when a strike is registered in the virtual card enrollment strike database because a user rejects the bubble, or when strikes are cleared because the user accepted enrollment.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebOTP.OneTimeCode.FillDuration.FromInteraction
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between the user's first interaction with a form and the form's submission, for form with autocomplete="one-time-code". An interaction requires changing a form control's value manually or via autofill. The interaction can happen on a different form than the one which is submitted. This is recorded once per form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebOTP.OneTimeCode.FillDuration.FromLoad
histogram.summary: Time elapsed between form load and form submission, for forms with autocomplete="one-time-code". This is recorded once per form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebOTP.OneTimeCode.FromAutocomplete
histogram.summary: Records whether a frame has ever used autocomplete="one-time-code" during its lifecycle. i.e. it's only recorded once per frame. In addition, we only record it if the frame has parsed forms.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebOTP.PhoneNumberCollection.ParseResult
histogram.summary:
Records whether a frame collects phone number based on the field classification. It records once per frame only if it has parsed forms.
Note that the field types may not be calculated if there are less than 3 fields in the form unless an autocomplete attribute is provided. e.g. if the form has only a single field regarding phone number without specifiying autocomplete="phone", a sample with "false" will be reported.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebOTP.PhonePlusWebOTPPlusOTC
histogram.summary: Records whether a document collected phone number, and/or used WebOTP, and/or used OneTimeCode (OTC) during its lifecycle. i.e. it's recorded in the browser process when a document is destroyed.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.AutofillSession
histogram.summary: Records the state of an autofill session.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.AutofillSessionWithBottomSheet
histogram.summary: Records the state of an autofill session in the presence of a bottom sheet. Emitted at the end of a session (i.e. on submit, on start of a new session, or on destruction of the WebContents).

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.BottomsheetNoViewStructureDelay
histogram.summary: Records the time it took between sending a prefill request to the Android Autofill framework and the bottom sheet failing to show because no Autofill ViewStructure was ever requested by the framework. Emitted whenever a user focuses a field for which a prefill request was sent and the missing ViewStructure is the reason that we record for not having shown the bottom sheet.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.CreatedByActivityContext
histogram.summary: Whether the autofill is created by activity context.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.Enabled
histogram.summary: Whether the autofill service is enabled in Android platform.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.Funnel.FillAfterInteraction{AutofillFormType}
histogram.summary:
Counts whether users filled the form, given that they have already interacted with the form.
This metric is recorded on Android WebView, only for forms that users interacted with. It is recorded only once per form, meaning that it does not matter if the user fills the form multiple times. If a form changes dynamically, then Autofill treats the different versions of the form as different forms. {AutofillFormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.Funnel.InteractionAfterParsedAsType{AutofillFormType}
Autofill.WebView.Funnel.ParsedAsType{AutofillFormType}
histogram.summary:
Counts whether a form was parsed/interpreted to be of the type indicated in the histogram name.
This metric is recorded once for each form observed by Autofill on Android WebView. If a form changes dynamically, then Autofill treats the different versions of the form as different forms. {AutofillFormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.Funnel.SubmissionAfterFill{AutofillFormType}
histogram.summary:
Counts whether users submitted a form that was filled via autofill.
This metric is recorded once for each form observed by Autofill on Android WebView but only for forms that the user filled via Autofill. {AutofillFormType}

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.KeyMetrics.FillingAssistance{AutofillFormType}
Autofill.WebView.KeyMetrics.FillingCorrectness{AutofillFormType}
Autofill.WebView.KeyMetrics.FormSubmission.Autofilled{AutofillFormType}
Autofill.WebView.KeyMetrics.FormSubmission.NotAutofilled{AutofillFormType}
Autofill.WebView.PrefillRequestState
histogram.summary: Records the state of a prefill request (was a request sent, was it answered, was a bottom sheet shown) for a form that was deemed cacheable. Emitted whenever OnAskForValuesToFill is triggered on a cacheable form.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.Provider.PackageName
histogram.summary: Records the Autofill provider on the device if it matches a fixed list of package names or unknown otherwise. This is recorded once for a given AwContents. It is recorded on AutofillProvider initialization. Only recorded in Android P and beyond.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.ServerPrediction.AwGSuggestionAvailability
histogram.summary: Records whether Autofill with Google has suggestions and if the user selects any suggestion. It is recorded when the form is submitted. Only recorded in Android P and beyond.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.ServerPredicton.HasValidServerPrediction
histogram.summary: Records whether the server prediction of any field isn't NO_SERVER_DATA. This histogram is recorded when the server prediction is available for the current form.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.ServerPredicton.PredictionAvailability
histogram.summary: Records whether and when the server prediction response of current autofill session is available even if query failed or there is no server data. This histogram is recorded when the prediction becomes available or the new session starts.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.SubmissionSource
histogram.summary: Records the source of form submission.

histogram.name: Autofill.WebView.SuggestionTime
histogram.summary: The time taken to display suggestion.
